question_text: Why might a technician see fiber terminated outside a home and converted to copper inside?
answer_options: Copper transmits more data than fiber indoors
Fiber degrades quickly in warm temperatures
Consumer equipment commonly supports copper interfaces
Fiber is required to shield against electrical surges
correct_answer: Consumer equipment commonly supports copper interfaces
explanation: Although fiber can reach the home, many consumer-grade routers and devices use RJ45 copper Ethernet, requiring conversion from fiber to copper.
